title: Saif Ali Khan stabbing news: How railway police zeroed in on suspect in train - Hindustan Times
summary:
Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Suspect Detained by Railway Police

Date & Source: Jan 18, 2025, Hindustan Times

The Railway Protection Force (RPF) detained a suspect in the Saif Ali Khan stabbing case while he was travelling by the Jnaneswari Express train in Durg district, Chhattisgarh.

  • The suspect, Aakash Kanojia, was located using information from the Mumbai police.
  • Kanojia was apprehended in the train's general coach based on a photo and tower location provided by the Mumbai police.
  • Saif Ali Khan was attacked in his home, resulting in multiple stab wounds.
  • He was treated at Lilavati Hospital and is reported to be out of danger.
  • The Mumbai police have assembled over 20 teams to find the intruder who attacked Khan.
"The suspect's identity was confirmed through a video call with Mumbai Police. He has been detained. Further interrogation will be done by Mumbai Police." - Sanjay Sinha, RPF in-charge at Durg

The swift action by the RPF showcases the effective collaboration between state police forces in the wake of a serious incident involving a public figure.
newTitle: Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Suspect Detained by Railway Police

title: Diljit Dosanjh's Panjab 95 to release internationally next month without any cuts, but not in India - Hindustan Times
summary:
Diljit Dosanjh's Panjab 95 to Release Internationally Next Month Without Cuts

Date: Jan 18, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The much-anticipated film Panjab 95, featuring Diljit Dosanjh, is set for a global release on February 7 without any cuts, although it will not be available in India.

  • The film is directed by Honey Trehan and produced by RSVP Movies.
  • Panjab 95 centers on human rights activist Jaswant Singh Khalra.
  • The film will explore the human rights violations and disappearances during Punjab's militancy period.
  • It was previously scheduled to premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival but was removed from the line-up.
  • Jaswant Singh Khalra mysteriously disappeared in 1995 while investigating mass cremations in Punjab.
‚ÄúPanjab 95 releases in Cinemas Internationally only on 7th February. PS Full Movie, No Cuts #ChallengetheDarkness,‚Äù Diljit Dosanjh announced.

This movie's release is a significant moment, shedding light on important historical issues related to human rights abuses in Punjab.
newTitle: Diljit Dosanjh's Panjab 95 to Release Internationally Next Month Without Cuts
